Above the final 50 years, the terms hubcaps' and wheel covers' are becoming synonymous since the lightweight, full-diameter decorative coverings of standard steel wheels.

The Present Perfect Tense

This Spanish Grammar lesson addresses the Present Perfect Tense. Equivalent to English, the Present Perfect in Spanish is a compound tense that is utilized regularly, and very easy to learn. The Present Ideal is actually a compound tense since it demands an auxiliary verb, haber (to have) along with the past participle in the verb. As in English, the verb haber often comes prior to the

present participle.

The conjugation pattern is as follows:

To get (Present tense) + Previous Participle

Right here is definitely an illustration tiffany outlet from the present excellent tense in English:

Carl has worked a good deal this year.

Within the over illustration, the verb has worked' is in the Present Excellent Tense due to the fact it indicates a simple fact or an act in the past. tiffany outlet Even so additionally, it indicates a time period that has not fully elapsed.

Another use for the Present Excellent that is certainly similar to the www.officialtiffanycoshop.com preceding illustration, is always to express an action which has taken place, but whose time has not been certainly established.

Right here is another instance of the Present Best in English:

Martha has eaten quite little.

Within this illustration, the verb has eaten' is while in the Present Perfect to express that Martha ate tiffany outlet in the past. Nonetheless, it implies that a definite time in which this took place has not been determined.

To understand this tense far better, let's evaluation the conjugation from the auxiliary verb haber in the present tense:

Yo he (I have) nosotros hemos (we've)

t' has (you've) ellos han (they've)

'l ha (he has) ellas han (they have)

Ella ha (she has) ustedes han (you've got)

Usted ha (you've)

Bear in mind, with haber conjugated in the present tense, all that must be incorporated could be the previous participle in the verb that is intended.

With this in mind, what follows tiffany outlet could be the conjugation for the Present Excellent for -ar verbs.

Hablar (To Speak) Previous Participle: Hablado (Spoken)

Yo he hablado (I've spoken) nosotros hemos hablado (we have spoken)

t' has hablado (you might have spoken) ellos han hablado (they have spoken)

'l ha hablado (he has spoken) ellas han hablado (they have spoken)

ella ha hablado (she hasspoken) ustedes han hablado (you have spoken)

usted ha hablado (you have spoken)

Right here is an illustration with hablar:

Jaime ha hablado mucho de su boda.

(Jaime has spoken a great deal about his wedding.)

As soon as again, discover how comparable the conjugation pattern for the Present Perfect is in Spanish and English. , The auxiliary verb haber (to possess) often comes prior to the past participle of the verb.

Conjugations for typical -er and and -ir verbs mirror a comparable pattern.

Comer (to consume) Previous Particple: Comido (Eaten)

Yo he comido (I have eaten) nosotros hemos comido (we've got eaten)

t' has comido (you have eaten) ellos han comido (they've eaten)

'l ha comido (he has eaten) ellas han comido (they have eaten)

ella ha comido (she has eaten) ustedes han comido (you've got eaten)

usted ha comido (you've eaten)

Here is an instance with comer:

He comido mucho hoy. (I have eaten a good deal these days.)

Salir (to go out) Previous Participle: Salido (Gone out)

Yo he salido (I've gone out) nosotros hemos salido (we've got gone out)

t' has salido (you have gone out) ellos han salido (they have gone out)

'l ha salido (he has gone out) ellas han salido (they have gone out)

ella ha salido (she has gone out) ustedes han salido (you might have gone out)

usted ha salido (you might have gone out)

Right here is an example with salir:

Juan Carlos ha salido mucho esta noche.

(Juan Carlos has gone out a whole lot tonight.)

Even the verb ir, that's usually an irregular verb in Spanish, includes a regular conjugation while in the Present Best.

Ir (to go) Past Participle: Ido (gone)

Yo he ido (I've gone) nosotros hemos ido (we've gone)

t' has ido (you've gone) ellos han ido (they've gone)

'l ha ido (he has gone) ellas han ido (they have gone)

Ella ha ido (she has gone) ustedes han ido (you have gone)

Usted ha ido (you've gone)

What follows really are a few examples using the Present Ideal Tense:

Andr's ha pensado mucho en su pa's.

(Andr's has believed a whole lot about his country.)

Mi vecina Rosa y su hija Carmen han estado en casa todo el d'a.

(My neighbor and her daughter Carmen have already been home all day.)

La Rep'blica Dominicana ha producido peloteros excelentes.

(The Dominican Republic has produced outstanding baseball players.)

Este a'o, hemos donado nuestras computadoras a esa organizaci'n.

(This year, we've donated our personal computers to that organization.)

(I have been in New York because the year 2000.)

(You've got been on a diet program.)

Despite the Present Perfect's comparatively easy conjugation, it should be noted that the Present Best Tense is also used with reflexive verbs.

This really is expressed in the following instance:

Mi pap' se ha afeitado hoy.

(My father has shaved today.)

Note how the previously discussed pattern for the Present Excellent Tense is repeated. The only distinction is the fact that the reflexive pronoun should come ahead of the auxiliary verb haber and just before the past participle from the verb.

Reflexive Pronoun + Present tense of Haber + Past Participle

Other examples of reflexive verbs while in the Present Excellent Tense are:

(I have been tired a whole lot today.)

(Juanita's child has gotten sick.)

(The girls have had fun within the park.)

I just quit my last paying writing gig...and you should too!

I just quit my last paying writing gig. Why' Because I make more money giving my writing away. Yes, that's right. I make more money giving my writing away than I did selling my articles and columns. In fact I'm making more money writing part-time for free than I did in any of my full-time paid writing jobs and that includes advances and royalties from the publication of three novels. I have been writing professionally for two decades and I never thought I'd make more by writing for free but I am.
Tiffany Jewelry
But that's not even the best part -- and I know tiffany outlet you experienced writers will understand why this is better than money -- I can write whatever I want. I pick my topic and my slant. If I want to be funny or irreverent then I can be funny or irreverent. If I want to melancholy or maudlin then I can be melancholy or maudlin. It just doesn't matter because I'm writing to suit myself! I am my own boss and my own editor -- and I'm making money off my writing.
Tiffany Jewelry
How' I write for the internet. I have been doing so since 1999 and earning money during the entire time. I have written freelance and under contract for a number of internet www.officialtiffanycoshop.com publications and ventures as well as publishing my own work.

What internet venues am I using'

~ Ezines and Newsletters

~ Articles

How do I make money with these efforts'

~ Selling advertising space in my ezines
